website_summaries.verdict: An adequate starter pack for beginners, but not an instrument meant to last an entire musical career.
pros: A complete package of learning tools for the beginner
cons: Quality is somewhat sacrificed for price in this all-encompassing package

customer_reviews.title: Great! for the first month
customer_reviews.text: It was a good guitar while it lasted. It wasn't excellent or great, but good for it's value. I rarely play it since I went back to school, if anything, about 3 hours per week. In less than a month, the E string snapped. I stopped playing until I could get it repaired. Then suddenly the screw that was holding down the top portion of the guitar fell out. I have no idea what happened and am pretty irate at the fact that I dropped around $100 and this guitar snaps so easily. I would not recommend this product to anyone. This product is dysfunctional.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and has everything you need to get started at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with Rocksmith the xbox one game. My son loved it. His favorite color is green. Buy extra strings they seem to break a lot. We are certainly not experts in this field but I think after looking around at the prices and such it is a good entry guitar for your kids or anyone who is new and doesn't want to invest a fortune in something that might end up sitting in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: S. GarrettTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect guitar for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this with her own money because she wanted to learn guitar. She was attracted to the price. I would say that for the price it is amazing! Perfect for beginners! She is completely happy! It comes with a mini amp. If you are an advanced or professional guitar player then this would not be the guitar for you. But for beginner it is wonderful. It is a great price and allows them to learn and see if they even want to continue with the instrument, which half of the time kids and teens quit after a couple years, so why make a huge investment?
customer_reviews.author: OCmom

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Kit, Buy new strings and a tuner, though!
customer_reviews.text: I can't advise enough on following the recommendations of the other reviewers and buying yourself a set of high quality Ernie Ball strings to replace the stuff it comes with. A cheap little clip-on tuner was also a very worthwhile purchase. I first tried tuning the guitar with the original strings and it couldn't hold a note for crap. The Ernies were fantastic, though. I am an absolute beginner and bought this guitar to use with Rocksmith for learning. Very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: genkigeek

customer_reviews.title: very good starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: My nephew wanted to start a band (he's 7 yrs old ) and wanted to use my expensive guitar and amp. I told him there was no way after seeing him strum it viciously. So I bought this for him as a future gift. He has not seen it yet but I unboxed it, tuned it up and plugged it into my Fender Champion 100 Amp. It's my practice amp , the guitar sounded nice . I was surprised at the quality for this price. If you're starting out or need a 2nd guitar to practice on I would recommend this one .
customer_reviews.author: Terrgee5

customer_reviews.title: So frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Right out of box and the guitar doesn’t work. I tried the amp on another guitar so I know it works. Result, guitar doesn’t connect.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Frets need to be properly filed
customer_reviews.text: Guitar came in great. no dings or scratches but the frets are not filed correctly and after showing my son some riffs my hand looked like I played with a small blade with a hundred little cuts in the surface of my skin. Nothing deep at all, very small but very annoying to have to file myself.
customer_reviews.author: Cody A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Great Guitar!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson for Christmas, it wasn't supposed to arrive until after Christmas, but to our surprise it arrived 2 days before Christmas so he was able to open it and we were able to share in his joy and excitement! Thank you so much, this guitar is better than we even imagined, it's a great value for a beginner guitar, and it made my 13 year old grandson extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Y. Moustrouphis

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Easy to Play
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it, but has the same criticisms you'll see in the other reviews. Terrible amp and lacking in craftsmanship (knobs fall off and plastic frayed edging at seams). After you account for breaking-in the strings it is a dream to play. She even prefers it over her original acoustic guitar. For my part (knowing nothing) it looks good! The real value for me is how much she adores this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Shereezee

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GUITAR for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My son is in love with this. He's just starting to learn how to play the E-guitar. great kit for the price. However, the cover that's part of this starter kit, doesn't really fit the E-guitar. It looks like it would fit an acoustic. So we are buying a cover for it.
customer_reviews.author: JasminPearson

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed of the quality of the Items. The guitar needed to be set up, but after that, it plays really well. I was so happy, I ordered another one, different color, and after setup, plays really nice. I may very well get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue that was resolved
customer_reviews.text: The guitar I received was damaged - the plug would not stay in the guitar so it could not play through the amp. Also one of the strings was to low and it could not be played without hitting the frets. Overall this is a good beginner guitar for someone trying to learn to play guitar. Craftsmanship and quality control issues happen, so just be aware that if you have an issue you will need to get it resolved right away!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Steele

customer_reviews.title: Save more money for a real guitar
customer_reviews.text: Good "starter" guitar for a kid that needs to learn how to tune. It goes out of tune CONSTANTLY. If you're serious about starting a new hobby, or supporting someone that is, save up an extra $150 and get an actual instrument. If a budding musician starts with this, they will most likely quit. On the bright side, if you've ever wanted to smash a guitar on stage like a rock star this one would break easily!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Change strings as soon as you get it and even out the bridge
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good guitar, but when you get it, first just play around with it see what needs to be fixed. On mine the bridge was a little uneven, but it’s ok all you need is the little hex key (which it comes with) and a screwdriver (not included) and just follow a YouTube tutorial and that should be good. Also after your done expirementing with it change the strings, and don’t use the ones it comes with because they are just as bad as the ones on there. And after all that I think it should be good. It came in good condition, looked great, and plays great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaryan

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter who is at beginner level, but even at an intermediate level (myself) it hits the spot. Everything you need to get started on jamming at home and even do a little recording. Within the first month my daughter played in a makeshift school band and it sounded great. Nice sound, very decent quality for the price! We're very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: SRF

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought an acoustic & now electric guitar for my daughter & both are amazing. Such great quality for the price paid. Best Choice produces nothing but quality products as far as I’m concerned. 😍
customer_reviews.author: Autism Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 15 year old son for Christmas. A nice package for the beginner, includes everything you need to get started playing. Seems well made and sturdy, and he likes the look of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Cheap strings, but good product
customer_reviews.text: I love my guitar. I was hesitant to buy because a lot of reviews said the product came with damage and broken strings. It did come with a broken string. There were extra strings in the box and I was able to watch a YouTube video on how to restring it. That only took a few minutes and I was able to get started with it pretty quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great package deal!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my 11 year old’s first big purchase. My parents got her a keyboard and she taught herself. She then wanted an electric guitar. We told her she would have to buy it herself as the keyboard was recently purchased. So she did the research and found this listing. Came with everything pictured for a great price and the guitar itself is a good size. I also referred a friend to this listing when she stated she wanted to get one for her child as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The whole package
customer_reviews.text: Our 11 year old had been trying to play his dad's Les Paul. It was heavy and hard for him to manage. This guitar is light weight and perfect for him to learn on. The amp does well for the price and he was thrilled to have one of his own to play. This set comes with everything someone needs to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha Kiskaden

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am just starting to learn guitar and in college. I ordered this knowing that it wouldn't be professional quality, however I'm still impressed at how much better the guitar was than I expected. So far nothing has broken on it and It plays well and in tune. I even banged it on a stairwell on accident enough to make the whole place ring and it didn't show a scratch. The amp is small but works well. I figure if I treat it well, even though it's lower quality, it will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Shocked by the quality for the price. Excellent beginner guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the beginner to learn. Very surprised at the Quality for the price. You do need somebody who is a guitar player to set it up, put the strings on and tweak it. Bought it for 14 year old boy to introduce him to an instrument and get him away from the video game playing. There are even video games that will teach a beginner how to play. Best bang for your buck comes with everything to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Shamrocker1973

customer_reviews.title: Great First Electric
customer_reviews.text: I've been banging around on my acoustic guitar for several years now and finally took the dive into the world of electric guitars. As I didn't want to spend a fortune on something I might not use, this BC guitar came in at a great price, produces a good sound, and has all the necessities (if not niceties) a beginner could want. I'm quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: synchronicity313

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with broken pieces.
customer_reviews.text: Would’ve happily given this a better rating but opened it up and the screw to hold the strap on was snapped off the guitar. It was a gift and I didn’t know it came broken until it was opened and I was completely disappointed. My local music shop can hopefully fix this. Other than that it’s decent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save up more and get a nicer guitar
customer_reviews.text: I am kind of beginner who is is now starting to learn barre chords. So I have a little bit experience. I would advise you to save up more and buy a better guitar. The reason is the sound which is the most important thing obviously. It does not sound nice when you try to go for a little harder strum. Maybe it's just my luck with the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: P. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Decent for Beginners or practice
customer_reviews.text: Learning how to play on this one. Tremolo bar isn't necessary and loses tune easily with it. The plastic covering the body can difficult to remove completely. Dials could use a reference mark. Comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Ehh...
customer_reviews.text: First of all and probably the worst part is that when I got this guitar, I couldn't even really play it! The plastic fret piece at the very beginning of the neck was broke so the 6th strong just flopped around...a huge disappointment. Second, there is a HUGE gash/dent in the side of the guitar. It was a very beautiful finish that is now ruined. I could deal with the dent but that broken fret that holds the strings in place, I can't. However, it does play nice once you get past that part. And the amp is surprisingly loud and the overdrive is quite nice for being so small and cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For But This Is Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar for the price, you're not spending $80-90 and receiving a trash guitar with these guys. Now it might not play exactly like a $5000 guitar, but then again, you get what you pay for. This is 100% the guitar I would reccomend ANYONE new to playing guitar, as it's an inexpensive choice! I can't wait to buy a second one, they are really nice guitars. I don't know how they are selling for $90, they must be making small profit because its worth every penny <3
customer_reviews.author: David A Finley

customer_reviews.title: Needed some setup
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for the price, after some setup was performed. The strings would not remain in tune- changed those and conditioned the fret board which was really dry, adjusted the bridge and neck,, now it plays pretty well - out of the box, I can see a beginner getting discouraged if the setup wasn't done.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Burcham

customer_reviews.title: Guitar and Amp Broken on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived early. which was nice, but the packaging was punctured, ripped, and it looks like it was dropped multiple times. The guitar had a large chip out of the finish which I was going to overlook, but the Amp was broken as well so back it goes. Spending my money elsewhere since a refund is the only return option.
customer_reviews.author: carlton aurelius

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had been what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This electric guitar was perfect with tons of extras. When opening it I wasn’t expecting it to be as nice as it was but to my surprise it was actually worth more than I had paid for. I wish it was what I was needing but my sons 6th grade band class is requiring a 4 string bass electric guitar and the only reason I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal Cruz

customer_reviews.title: My personal experience totally worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Was looking to get back into playing, bought this kit, absolutely wonderful for the money. Use this kit until you're positive you'll keep playing, then you'll upgrade. But for a new player or somebody looking to get back into playing, this item was awesome, guitar, amp, everything is worked for me great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Worst possible option
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is very poorly constructed, the tremolo arm broke the first day, it was some kind of chromed covered plastic, now one piece is stuck inside the guitar and you can't replace it. Spend a little more money and get something better, this guitar will not last and you will lose your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow did not expect this set to be as good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Got this set within two days of purchase I was so excited that it came that fast! First off packaging was good came with all that was advertised, guitar and amp seem of decent quality for what you pay for I was happy, no scratches, dings, or flaws from what other reviewers were mostly complaining about maybe I got a good one?? No complaints works good sounds good only flaw for me is amp had a lot of static when not playing but goes away soon as you start jamming other than that highly recommend for beginners or a cheap play around guitar.
customer_reviews.author: tony ciampoli

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner like me
customer_reviews.text: What would you expect for such a low price? It is fine for me, a beginner at the guitar. It is not perfect, no no no! The amp is kinda basic, well really basic..... It like the size of a show box. The guitar is sturdy, No warped wood etc.... My guitar instructor tuned it for me and noticed that the high E string sounds a bit abnormal. I can't tell the difference but he is a professional musician and he can. Other than that he said it's a good instrument. I figured buying this wouldn't be a huge hit to my purse if I decide not to continue playing guitar.
customer_reviews.author: G-Unit

customer_reviews.title: Good enough quality starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: What more can you ask for, for under a hundred bucks including shipping? Quality is just fine. No major problems. I did change the strings out to a set of Ernie Ball Regular Slinky, and found the sound to be much improved. As far as the amp goes, I can't tell you much, as I haven't turned it on yet. The guitar is a perfect starter, so what if it gets banged around. If you stick with it, then save up and get yourself a nice one. This one will do just fine till then. I bought this to play Rocksmith 2014 and it works great with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Galasso

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Guitar
customer_reviews.text: The guitar is a great starter guitar. It has real weight and feel to it. Very decent guitar for the price. The case is nice to have, but it's nothing special. The other accessories seem to be of typical quality. The amp leaves a lot to be desired if you're looking for good sound, but it works well enough for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My son used his birthday money to buy his first guitar. After lots of research and reading reviews he chose this one. He is so happy with it. It's definitely meant to be used for a beginner. We got exactly what we were looking for and for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: but I really love my guitar
customer_reviews.text: I was worried at first when I made this purchase after reading some reviews, but I really love my guitar!! It came in quick and without any scratches or breaks in the packaging. The little amp it comes with is very nice! It produces such a big sound for a little amp and comes with overdrive built in. I like how the guitar looks black at certain angles and blue at others. You almost think its black, but when you get closer you see its beautiful blue. The only thing is that I wish it came with instructions or a picture explaining what the dials and knobs mean.
customer_reviews.author: Ally B

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: This guitar looks great, played fine out of the box. The little amp has a very clean and clear sound, which is fine, but I hooked it up, instead, to my somewhat bigger amp with a "gain" knob to achieve distortion and, therefore, to get that classic louder, fuzzy, rock and roll guitar sound. The amp is great for beginners, this is really no complaint, but just keep in mind you'll probably want to get a bigger amp before long if you are a rock music fan.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite guitar but the price do catches eyes.
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is fine if you just want something to play with. Originally I got this guitar to play on Rocksmith because of its price. Again you get what you paid for. The guitar goes out of tune easily and also the frets are not installed on the right place causing the note to be different which is not recognized by Rocksmith. Another thing is the action on the guitar string is rather low, which makes the buzzing sound during regular play. This fact makes it very frustrating for guitar beginners. Other than guitar, I do love the accessories that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Wong

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Wow this guitar is definitely worth it. Sound great amp sounds is good. I snapped the high pitch e string and was able to easily fix it with the replacement ones. Definitly worth the money if you want a inexpensive good guitar to rock out :)
customer_reviews.author: samuel cruz

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a starter set for myself. Never played the guitar before and didn't want to sink a lot of money into something I wasn't sure I'd stick with. Had a friend set it up for me, and couldn't be happier. You just can't beat what you get for the price. Guitar is solid and plays fine. Amp is cheap but works just fine. This is probably the best beginner set you'll find. Three months later and everything is working as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Kounter

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to learn to play guitar. Was not disappointed in the packaging & it’s been a lot of fun whenever I pick up the guitar on my free time. Minus 1 star because when it got to me there was a clear indication that it hadn’t been handled with care and therefore had a noticeable indentation on the chassis of the guitar. But nonetheless it works well and I love my guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: an excellent service. successful vendor
customer_reviews.text: This was my first electric guitar. Obviously you aren’t going to get flawless intense tones out of a sub $150 guitar that comes with an amp, but for a starter guitar it was great! The body was beautiful and the fretboard was comfortable. The amp is obviously a cheap amp but a beginner wouldn’t even notice. Just turn up the base on the amp and it will sound fine. If you are looking for a slightly nicer beginner Stratocaster style guitar I would recommend a squire, but if you’re just looking to see if electric guitar is for you than this guitar will do perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: davıd

customer_reviews.title: Like buying a plastic kiddy pool because you wanna learn to surf
customer_reviews.text: At first, I loved this guitar. I learned a few cool chords, and the practice amp wasn't terrible, but after a few days of trying to practice with it, the subpar quality really started to show. The Low E is virtually impossible to keep in tune or strum hard enough without it flying all over the place. All the strings lose tune after a few days, and the overall quality of the neck is pretty low. I didn't realise just how bad it was until I picked up a real guitar. It'll get you interested in learning, but you're better off just saving an extra hundred bucks and buying a real guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Defective on Christmas night!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything looks great until my daughter tried plugging the cord to the guitar and won't stay in. I have to hold it for her to here the sound. Returning it for that defective part. Afraid to buy another guitar from them if they have the same problem and have to return it that one also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for learning, tough for seasoned players.
customer_reviews.text: I love how good this is for a teen like my brother to start playing. This has got him into loving how to make music. There are a lot of things going for this bundle but the amp is a downfall. It sounds bad with too much gain which is required for hard rock and metal riffs. But if you replace the amp it’s a good starter for rock and metal. Not great if you want an acoustic style sound though. My advice, but this and learn. Once you master your preferred genre then upgrade to a higher level guitar and amp and you’ll be golden.👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Hayden W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend as she was just learning. The guitar is surprisingly great quality, and the amp puts out good sound for its size. 3 years later, we are still using it for daily lessons and have had no issues. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainCraboo

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Money, Great Guitar for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for our son who is learning guitar and he absolutely loves it. He has been using this guitar for 4 months now and so far we have not had any issues with the product. We had issues with the delivery of this product but Best Choice was quick to send a replacement. We were pleasantly surprised by the swift response from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Varun Nagrath

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a really nice little beginner setup. Keep in mind, you are getting a electric guitar, case, amp, and all required cables for under $100. With that said, the amp is the one thing I would want to improve on. the sound quality is fair at best, and there is not a lot of volume before it gets really distorted.
customer_reviews.author: Rhett Radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Beautiful, Great sound! Surpassed my Expectations! A++++
customer_reviews.text: High quality, Great sound and even better looking in person than online. This was a gift for our daughter and this was a crazy good deal for a start up guitar kit. We didn't want to spend a lot of money in case she decided the guitar wasn't her thing. This seems like a very high quality set for such little money invested. I would recommend this set to a child and adult! It sounds good and looks amazing! Thank you Amazon for offering this great deal! A++++
customer_reviews.author: Christinas Cavaliers

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality guitar
customer_reviews.text: I have got this -what they call electric guitar- 3 week ago and it sounded sooo bad. I took it to a music center in San Diego. The guitar technician checked it very carefully and said it needed to be intuned. Apart from this, the frets were not trimmed properly and it could really cut your fingers, I’m NOT KIDDING!!! He had to smothen the frets down. Stay away from this product and DON’T waste your money on this disappointing thing they call guitar.
customer_reviews.author: shady Bishai

customer_reviews.title: Broke in one month
customer_reviews.text: The volume went out on this after a month or so. Had 2 professionals look at it & there is a short inside the wiring that can’t be fixed. I have $100 doorstop now & a disappointed 11 year old. Emailed the company. Hopefully they can make this right.
customer_reviews.author: Shannonrae79

customer_reviews.title: This is beyong nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter. She loves music and plays a few instruments. She wanted to add this to her collection so she can learn how to play. She absolutely loves this. It is very sturdy well made and looks extremely expensive.
customer_reviews.author: khalia Spencer

customer_reviews.title: A gift sadly already broken?
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my brother because he always wanted an electric guitar with the amp to play his favorites songs. Sadly when it came, the machine heads were jacked up and had to see a professional to fix them. The guitar wouldn't tune right you see because one of the heads wouldn't turn and the other could turn but never tighten the string. Anyway after that got fixed, the guitar sounded great and the amp was okay as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as a first electric guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter as a first electric guitar and she really likes it. I don't know a whole lot about guitars but I think that this is a great option for a first electric guitar, since the price is reasonable and from what I've seen the quality is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It's of course not going to sound the bes and you will need to tune it before each play, however it is PERFECT for beginners. It comes with everything you need to get started. Setup is extremely easy. Ive been teaching myself for a month now and it's been wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Seemed like a wiring issue in either the guitar or amp
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. Had a buzz. The buzz was helped with a higher quality cable but it was still there. It would go away if I touched the stew strings. Seemed like a wiring issue in either the guitar or amp.
customer_reviews.author: Yohan

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES it! Definitely need to buy different strings and extra picks, but no complaints. The amp is crisp and louder than you'd expect. Sounds great for such a tiny one! I would totally recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for a little while, and then the ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for a little while, and then the electric part of the guitar just stopped working. It'd probably work well enough for long enough to decide whether you'll get into guitar or not.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The guitar is decent... but, the amp is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: The guitar was easy to set up and get in tune. And it plays really well. I'm joking. I had to resolder the whole mess. And the amp is... well a joke. At full volume the amp can't be heard over the guitar itself. But amp aside (I have a different amp) after soldering the electronics (wasn't even done) I have a guitar I can beat the dickens out of.
customer_reviews.author: Jason McFall

customer_reviews.title: Very good start.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price and I do recommend it. My only complaints are the the amplifier that it comes with is pretty bad so I highly suggest investing in an amp before a new guitar. Also the guitar dosn't stay in tune all that much but if you take it domewhere for a setup then you're gold.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but good price for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my son's first electric guitar. Only giving 4 stars because there was a film coating some of the pickups had a grease coming off of them. I assume it's all protective stuff, but the film that came off didn't seem like the normal stuff they use on everything. It sounds pretty good, and he has no complaints. The amp is a little underwhelming, but for the price it's a great beginner's electric guitar!
customer_reviews.author: Tom R.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointing it the way it's made. The little strap metal hooks are not in good places so the one on the bottom of guitar has come loose and that's not good. Now my grandson cant use his straps
customer_reviews.author: Lynette

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, for the price
customer_reviews.text: This kit is pretty good for the price, but there are some very concerning things that I should address. The wood is not curved right. Basically, the action is extremely high, making solos harder to play on. For a second opinion, I visited a tech, and they said that the only issues would be the fretboard and the action. Other than that, this would work for a complete beginner, but eventually, you would want to buy a higher-end guitar. The amp, however, is pretty good. Big sound for a little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Inspire

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a great set.
customer_reviews.text: Tuning peg was slipping which made the Hi E string impossible to tune. Also the cable or the port on the guitar does not fit properly making the sound cut in and out on the amp. If it was not for those issues it would have been a great kit. But I am having to send it back. I recommend just buying the fender or epiphone kit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for as a beginner guitar. The shipping box was trashed and the product was damaged. No luck so far getting a replacement or reimbursed. Super bummed. Was looking forward to this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nott

customer_reviews.title: Great for playing rocksmith
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE it. If you need a guitar or want to learn how to play, this is what you want. There's absolutely nothing wrong with its strings like I read in another review. It comes with extra strings in case you want to replace them. The bag is flimsy and not the padded kind, but great for the price. A layer of clear wrap was peeling off the white part, but I'm guessing that was just to protect the surface from scratches... Playing this with rocksmith.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Expect a sizable setup, but decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The guitar I received has a poorly finished fretboard with fret wire like a cheese grater. It requires a sizable amount of setup, and the fretboard needs to be cleaned up, filed/sanded to smooth the edges, and oiled. Other than that, its not a bad guitar for 90 bucks. The amp that comes with it is a powerhouse for its size. All in all, its not a bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Seg

customer_reviews.title: Good starter guitar.
customer_reviews.text: Good little guitar hold tune for a long time although mine never came with an amp, cords or strings. A little dissappointed going through my old purchases and reviewing also my guitar came with a loose wire for my knobs so they only partially work need to fix that at some point but all around my bros enjoy the sound quality of this little guitar one more thing it is cheaper than when,I purchased it so thats a plus for everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: It works, its functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm not Slash or Santana. Not ever going to be Slash or Santana. So this is a nice little cheap practice guitar that the wife won't kill me for buying. Buy a 10 guitar, see where you sleep after that.
customer_reviews.author: Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: No idea. I had to send it back as soon as I got it. The guitar would not plug into the amp. It’s been 3 weeks and I still have not received a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: R Todd Browning

customer_reviews.title: scratches on pickguard
customer_reviews.text: Opened packaging to find scratches on pickguard and nicks on strings....WHY did we pay for a NEW guitar only to receive a USED guitar?!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My teen son has been thrilled so far with this purchase. Our only complaint is the bag is pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica holloway

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The guitar came packaged in a nice box. Once we opened I can clearly see scratches and dents on the guitar. Also the necks finish is not so smooth and kids can cut their hands if not careful due to protruding or misplaced frets which have sharp pointy edges. Will be contacting the support/seller team to see what they can do about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 100% happy and giddy to have it
customer_reviews.text: I found that the packaging takes a lot of abuse better packaging material overall great quality comes with to Alan Keyes extra strings pick whammy bar great kids for someone who wants to learn to play the electric guitar but doesn't want to spend a whole bunch like me
customer_reviews.author: DAVID

customer_reviews.title: They stand behind their product!
customer_reviews.text: We had a problem getting this in tune, even after working on it for a few months. My daughter was frustrated as it was her first guitar. Finally submitted a warranty claim and they sent out a new one. Thank you for making an little girl happy!
customer_reviews.author: Wiltony

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: We received this guitar today for our daughters birthday, her first guitar, her birthday is in 3 days. It was damaged, completely chipped on the upper corner of the guitar!!! Completely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality easy to play
customer_reviews.text: This guitar surprised me. It seems to be well put together. I plays well. Now just to be clear, this is not a $1000 plus Fender Stratocaster. I purchased for my granddaughter who wants to be a 9 year old guitar star. This will be a good first guitar for her. It will be much easier for her to begin playing than an acoustic guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a great buy for anyone starting
customer_reviews.text: We bought this package for our grandson who is in the learning process for guitar playing. His parents had bought him a standard guitar, but my grandson got turned on when some of his friends had electric guitars. Needless to say, our grandson was blown away when we gave him this. His parents, nor we grandparents, couldn't believe the quality, sound, etc of this electric guitar. It is a great buy for anyone starting out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, love it!
customer_reviews.text: WAS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY DAUGHTER AND SHE LOVED IT!!! PLAYS EVERY DAY! COULDNT BE HAPPIER! WELL MADE, JUST ONE OF THE KNOBS FOR THE STRAP WAS BROKEN WHEN SHE OPENED IT, BUT SHE DOESNT SEEM BOTHERED BY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Bean

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my nephew he seems to love it so I have to say it's a good product and came as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy! It’s basic! I’ll let you know if it’s a long term type of thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basic guitar! It’s solid and yes the amp is small but I bought it for my 10 year old who wants to learn! I set up lessons and got the Xbox Rocksmith game! He is so freakin happy! I went back and forth trying to decide on acoustic or this but I have no regrets! I have a rockstar who just wants to play guitar! This is so much fun his uncle is very jealous!
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: ... a guitar noob but to me this is a great deal. very fun and quality guitar for a ...
customer_reviews.text: im a guitar noob but to me this is a great deal. very fun and quality guitar for a super good price. the only thing i suggest is a different amp if you want some distortion.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good starter guitar. The amp is much smaller than expected but you get what you pay for so I can't be upset. I got it during a lighting deal as well so it was a great deal. The guitar is good, pretty hard to tune as it doesn't really stay tuned for long before going back out of tune. Also parts of the wood were kind of rough and I felt as though I may get a splinter, it just needed a bit more sanding down. Other than that its a good beginner pack.
customer_reviews.author: K Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal, annoying plastic
customer_reviews.text: Great bundle for reasonable price. Guitar is slick and and has a cool faded to sapphire color. Clear sound and strong strings. Plastic cover blends in so well I thought it was supposed to be attached per ineptly and left it on for months. Only problem is said cover comes off around nobs and gets stuck underneath. It seems small but it's rather difficult to get out and if left alone vibrates annoyingly. Other than that amp is nice and smooth with comfortable stamps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The guitar was beautiful but had a chip in it
customer_reviews.text: The guitar was beautiful but had a chip in it...Had to send it back and reordered it...to be delivered Jan 5. Grandson loved it but was disappointed that it had to be sent back. It was NOT packed very well...not enough protection. The amp seemed to have a problem...did not sound right but after being "worked on" it was ok....The nice thing about Amazon is you stand behind your products and always make things right. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Nice and pretty. Came with everything listed and shown in picture. Big huge smile from the birthday girl.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda McCreary

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Completely satisfied. Very solid guitar and sounds great. Keeps tuned with no issues. My son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MOMOF3BOYS

customer_reviews.title: Cord will not stay in guitar
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much having the same problem other people are having. The cord will not stay in the guitar, which means that it will not play on the amp. I've also looked in the hole, and it doesn't appear there is anything for the cord to connect to. What a bummer, considering this was a Christmas present for my two kids.
customer_reviews.author: The Master Mc

customer_reviews.title: Guitar didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The guitar's plug conector was messed up and you can't connect the aux cord to it. Honestly I just kept it because it comes with the amp and the other accessories and only paid $40 for the whole thing since I got a $50 Christmas gift card. If you're looking for a guitar you can actually practice and play don't buy this crap, go to a Guitar Center and buy a brand new guitar that will actually work well even if it's more expensive it will last you more.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our teenage daughter as a first guitar to see if she liked it before investing more money in a nicer one. This is GREAT for how cheap it is.
customer_reviews.author: Emilystan00

customer_reviews.title: ... a beginner and I thought this package was a great price for what it included
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 19 yr old son for Christmas- he is a beginner and I thought this package was a great price for what it included. Well, I received it today and there are 2 scratches and 1 scrape on the sides of the guitar-but the finish is beautiful. I can't return it since there are only 4 days until Christmas but for the price, I guess you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been playing this daily since it arrived. Excellent choice for the money. I didn't give it a full 5-star rating because she carried it to\from school & the guitar dents easily in case if it's bumped.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: We replaced the strings with a better quality string
customer_reviews.text: we bought this as a gift for my 13 year old son. He loves it! We replaced the strings with a better quality string, but that was not really needed. It worked just fine with what it came with. Turned out to be a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Was given this for Christmas and I am impressed with the quality of everything you get in the package deal. Love the black laq finish, and the light color neck. Been playing, learing with Rocksmith and it works great. I will suggest that you get strings that you like, maybe better quality. Also, take it to guitar center or a professional to check the Intunation. My action is a little off and am having some slight string vibration on the frets. Other than that, awesome guitar, very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith U.

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Nice little set up my son loves it everything in order and as described except side pocket zipper is missing and pocket is ripped
customer_reviews.author: aq

customer_reviews.title: Low-Cost Accessibility to Learning the Guitar
customer_reviews.text: It's gotta' be clear that these aren't the greatest pieces of equipment ever made, so with that and the price in mind, there's really no ill can be said of this deal. I bought this guitar and amp for the express purpose of developing my proficiency on guitar with Rocksmith. I've had a hand-me-down acoustic for over a decade now and just haven't really put the dedication together to really learn it. So doubling down on gamified instruction has really helped me make some progress, and this set was exactly what I needed to make it possible.
customer_reviews.author: Damon R. Nagy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son who is a drummer, who always wanted to learn the guitar. This guitar straight out of the package was absolutely amazing. The sound quality, the feel of the guitar was so much more than expected. I am considering purchasing a bass guitar to match.
customer_reviews.author: VER`MON DUPREE

product_meta.title: Best Choice Products 39in Full Size Beginner Electric Guitar Starter Kit with Case, Strap, Amp, Whammy Bar - Black
product_meta.description: Color:BlackGet ready to rock! This full size electric guitar set has everything beginners and pros need right out of the box. Whether you’re just learning the basics or you’ve mastered every chord, this guitar set is good for rockin’ and rollin’ all night long. SPECIFICATIONS: Guitar Dimensions: 39.5"(L) x 10.5"(W) x 2"(H); Amp Dimensions: 10"(L) x 3.25"(W) x 10.5"(H); String Dimensions: 25.59”(L); Weight: 5.55 lbs.; Color: Black; Material: Composite Hardwood; Includes: 1 Guitar, 1 Carrying Case, 1 Strap, 1 10W Amp, 1 Tremolo Bar, 1 Set of Extra Strings, 1 Pick; Intended Position: Right-hand; Power: 10W; No Assembly Required
feature_bullets: ALL-INCLUSIVE GUITAR SET: This ultimate starter kit includes a 39-inch electric guitar, 10W amp, amp cable cord, guitar pick, whammy bar (tremolo bar), shoulder strap, and replacement strings
DURABLE AND COMFORTABLE: Made of a classic hardwood body with a beautiful glossy finish for lasting use, and a 22-fret fingerboard lets you play comfortably
CARRYING BAG: Pack this guitar up in the included nylon gig bag to protect it from dust and scuffs as you take on the go
FOR ANY SKILL LEVEL: Perfect for beginning musicians just learning how to play or for experienced artists who want a practice guitar to travel with
AMP CONTROLS: Easily control Volume, Treble, Bass, Drive on the amp to achieve the perfect sound; GUITAR DIMENSIONS: 39"(L) x 10.5"(W) x 2"(H)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,200 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
